The following works for me, though the shasum's in the test don't match:

diff -r c34c7f881b4c cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake
--- a/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake    Thu Aug 14 15:15:19 2014 -0700
+++ b/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake    Thu Aug 14 15:38:12 2014 -0700
@@ -78,7 +78,7 @@

 ################################################
 # Require ruby-1.9 to parse ERB files
-find_package(Ruby 1.9)
+find_package(Ruby)
 if (NOT RUBY_FOUND)
   BUILD_ERROR("Ruby (ruby-dev) is required to parse ERB files.")
 endif()
diff -r c34c7f881b4c src/parser.cc
--- a/src/parser.cc Thu Aug 14 15:15:19 2014 -0700
+++ b/src/parser.cc Thu Aug 14 15:40:58 2014 -0700
@@ -883,12 +883,12 @@

   // Run the ERB parser
   VALUE ret = rb_eval_string_protect(cmd.c_str(), 0);

   // Convert ruby string to std::string
-  if (RSTRING(ret)->as.heap.ptr != NULL)
-    result.assign(RSTRING(ret)->as.heap.ptr, RSTRING(ret)->as.heap.len);
+  if (RSTRING(ret)->ptr != NULL)
+    result.assign(RSTRING(ret)->ptr, RSTRING(ret)->len);
   else
     sdferr << "Unable to parse string[" << _string << "] using ERB.\n";

   return result;
 }
